Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Sotorasib is approved to treat adults whose cancer has an abnormal KRAS gene. It is used in:

ItemizedList.ListItem: colorectal cancer that has spread to other parts of the body. It is used with panitumumab in patients who have received chemotherapy that included a fluoropyrimidine, oxaliplatin, and irinotecan hydrochloride.
non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC). It is used in patients who have received at least one other systemic therapy.¹

Section.Para: ¹This use is approved under FDA’s Accelerated Approval Program. As a condition of approval, confirmatory trial(s) must show that sotorasib provides a clinical benefit in these patients.
Sotorasib is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.
